meta.title: PSM E&D - Mission NEET PG 2.0 - Final Batch - 13-06-2025 - 2025-06-13

questions.text: A 33-year-old customs officer at an international airport develops fever and jaundice 4 days after returning from a work trip to Brazil. The health authorities suspect yellow fever and initiate specific measures. Which of the following best describes the public health action that should be applied to the officer's co-passengers who are asymptomatic but may have been exposed during travel?

options.label: B
options.text: Quarantine for 10 days with symptom monitoring

options.label: C
options.text: Quarantine for 6 days from last known exposure

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate vaccination and discharge without restriction

questions.correct_answer: C. Quarantine for 6 days from last known exposure
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Quarantine for 6 days from last known exposure

questions.text: A health economist is evaluating an intervention that prolongs life by 5 years but includes 2 years with moderate disability and 3 years in perfect health. Which of the following measures would best help assess the cost-effectiveness of this intervention?
A regional health team tracks weekly incidence of dengue fever, maps the spread, and launches vector control operations in response. This approach is classified as:
questions.correct_answer: B. Surveillance – due to integrated response
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Surveillance – due to integrated response

questions.text: A community-based leprosy elimination campaign involves house-to-house screening of asymptomatic individuals using skin examination and nerve palpation. Based on the phase of disease and intent of the intervention, this represents:

A health department statistically defines an influenza epidemic threshold using 5-year surveillance data. If mean is 40 cases/week and standard deviation is 10, which case count would satisfy the epidemic criteria?
A school-based hygiene campaign focuses on cleanliness as an ideal to be upheld by all students. Which of the following best characterizes "cleanliness" in this context?

A hospital records 50 new cases of diarrhea over 12 days among patients who consumed tap water. Daily new cases remain constant, with no evidence of clustering or interpersonal transmission. What is the most likely shape of the epidemic curve?

A medical journal publishes an editorial suggesting a new cancer biomarker. Clinicians hesitate to act on it, citing its placement in the EBM pyramid. Which of the following correctly identifies its evidence tier and associated limitation?

options.label: A
options.text: High tier; lacks replication in meta-analysis

options.label: B
options.text: Mid tier; prone to sampling bias

options.label: C
options.text: Low tier; based on subjective opinion, not empirical data

options.label: D
options.text: Bottom tier; derived from non-human experiments

questions.correct_answer: C. Low tier; based on subjective opinion, not empirical data
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Low tier; based on subjective opinion, not empirical data

questions.text: A study measuring the burden of chronic kidney disease in a community uses total known cases (both new and old) over the total population. If this parameter increases despite stable incidence, which factor most likely contributed?

options.label: A
options.text: Shorter disease duration due to increased mortality

options.label: B
options.text: Improved case detection and longer survival

options.label: D
options.text: Incorrect use of rate instead of proportion

questions.correct_answer: B. Improved case detection and longer survival
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Improved case detection and longer survival

questions.text: In a study of patients diagnosed with glioblastoma, 80 out of 100 patients died over 5 years. Based on this, which of the following is the correct survival rate, and what complementary epidemiological metric can be derived?

In a diabetic, cohort is being followed for nephropathy since 2010. Researchers in 2023 identify a subset that developed nephropathy and compare them to another subset who did not. They examine prior medication history starting from 2010. Which study design is embedded within the main cohort?
In a large cohort of miners exposed to silica dust, the RR for tuberculosis is 3.5. What does this mean with respect to the strength and direction of association?

options.label: A
options.text: There is a negative association between silica exposure and tuberculosis

options.label: B
options.text: The risk of TB is 3.5 times lower in non-exposed than in exposed

options.label: C
options.text: The exposure is protective against TB

options.label: D
options.text: The exposed group is 3.5 times more likely to develop TB than the non-exposed

questions.correct_answer: D. The exposed group is 3.5 times more likely to develop TB than the non-exposed
questions.explanation: Ans. D) The exposed group is 3.5 times more likely to develop TB than the non-exposed

questions.text: Match the bias to its most defining characteristic:

In a double-blind RCT evaluating a new antidepressant, neither the participants nor the prescribing physicians know who receives the drug or placebo. What type of bias is most directly prevented by this design feature?
Which of the following best describes the file drawer effect in the context of meta-analysis?

options.label: A
options.text: Inclusion of outdated studies stored in institutional archives

options.label: B
options.text: Overweighting of single-center trials in pooled analysis

options.label: C
options.text: Non-publication of small or negative studies leading to bias

options.label: D
options.text: Exclusion of gray literature based on language restrictions

questions.correct_answer: C. Non-publication of small or negative studies leading to bias
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Non-publication of small or negative studies leading to bias

questions.text: Which of the following vaccines is not contraindicated in pregnancy, despite being live-attenuated?

In a rural immunization session, an opened vial of TT was submerged in melted ice water but otherwise appeared undamaged. It was returned to the cold chain. What is the correct protocol per Open Vial Policy?

options.label: A
options.text: Reuse is allowed if expiry has not passed

options.label: B
options.text: Discard the vial due to potential contamination

options.label: C
options.text: Reuse only if the VVM is still in stage 1

options.label: D
options.text: Reuse only after shaking and ensuring no flocculation

questions.correct_answer: B. Discard the vial due to potential contamination
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Discard the vial due to potential contamination

questions.text: A 13-year-old girl in India visits a PHC for HPV vaccination. The physician decides to administer Cervavac. According to the national guidelines, what is the appropriate dosing schedule for her?
A vial of Vitamin A was found outside the ILR in a storage cabinet at room temperature. Which of the following best describes this storage condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Valid only for less than 48 hours

options.label: C
options.text: Acceptable, as Vitamin A is stored at room temperature

questions.correct_answer: C. Acceptable, as Vitamin A is stored at room temperature
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Acceptable, as Vitamin A is stored at room temperature

questions.text: A 3-month-old infant develops fever and persistent high-pitched crying 6 hours after DPT₃. The ANM mistakenly notes it as a seizure and withholds the booster. Which of the following would best guide correction of this error?

options.label: A
options.text: Absolute contraindication due to probable febrile encephalopathy

options.label: B
options.text: Crying is a minor adverse event and DPT booster is still indicated

options.label: C
options.text: DPT is contraindicated and DT should be given at 16–24 months

options.label: D
options.text: Switch to acellular pertussis formulation (DTaP) for booster

questions.correct_answer: C. DPT is contraindicated and DT should be given at 16–24 months
questions.explanation: Ans. C) DPT is contraindicated and DT should be given at 16–24 months

questions.text: Which COVID-19 vaccine is administered intranasally and utilizes a non-replicating viral vector platform?

A physician in a rural clinic reviews a newborn screening protocol. She explains to the intern that although Guthrie test was historically used for PKU, it has been largely replaced in modern labs. Which of the following reasons best justifies the replacement?

options.label: A
options.text: Lack of FDA approval for Guthrie’s microbial assay

options.label: B
options.text: Guthrie test is invasive and causes excessive pain

options.label: C
options.text: Tandem mass spectrometry provides greater specificity and broader detection

options.label: D
options.text: Guthrie test cannot detect phenylalanine-related metabolites

questions.correct_answer: C. Tandem mass spectrometry provides greater specificity and broader detection
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Tandem mass spectrometry provides greater specificity and broader detection

questions.text: A new screening tool for colorectal cancer is being evaluated in asymptomatic adults. If the test has a low LR⁺ and a high LR⁻, which of the following best describes its clinical utility?

options.label: B
options.text: Good screening tool for ruling out disease

options.label: D
options.text: Equally useful in pre- and post-test probability assessment

questions.correct_answer: B. Good screening tool for ruling out disease
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Good screening tool for ruling out disease

questions.text: A psychometric tool to assess anxiety is reviewed by a panel of experts in psychiatry. They unanimously agree that the tool measures all aspects of anxiety comprehensively. Which form of validity does this illustrate?

Regarding screening tests applied in parallel, which of the following statements is/are correct? 1. Combined sensitivity increases 2. Combined specificity increases 3. Combined NPV increases 4. Combined PPV increases

Which of the following statements regarding the period of communicability is/are true? Hepatitis A is communicable even before the onset of jaundice. Diphtheria remains communicable for at least 2 weeks even after symptom onset. Tetanus is not communicable from one person to another. Pertussis is contagious before the paroxysmal phase begins.

A 65-year-old man with fever, cough, and dyspnea is admitted with suspected COVID-19. The hospital lacks bronchoscopy services but has PPE and viral transport media. The physician wants to collect the most reliable diagnostic sample available at this time. Which of the following samples is most appropriate to send?

options.label: B
options.text: Nasal wash in dry sterile container

options.label: C
options.text: Throat and nasal swab in viral transport media

options.label: D
options.text: Sputum collected in viral transport media

questions.correct_answer: C. Throat and nasal swab in viral transport media
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Throat and nasal swab in viral transport media

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding parasitic host classification are true? Man is the definitive host for Taenia solium, while pigs are intermediate hosts. Cyclops serves as the definitive host for Dracunculus medinensis. Anopheles is the primary host for Plasmodium. Humans are dead-end hosts for Echinococcus granulosus.

A 9-year-old child has not received any vaccines and lives in a community with recent measles outbreaks. According to the WHO’s Measles Elimination Strategy, which of the following is the most appropriate initial approach?

options.label: C
options.text: Include the child in the catch-up immunization drive

questions.correct_answer: C. Include the child in the catch-up immunization drive
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Include the child in the catch-up immunization drive

questions.text: A 3-year-old child presents with fast breathing and mild chest indrawing. The healthcare provider administers a bronchodilator trial. After two doses, chest indrawing disappears, but fast breathing remains. The child has no danger signs and is alert. How should the child be managed next?

options.label: A
options.text: Classify as severe pneumonia and refer to hospital

options.label: B
options.text: Treat at home with bronchodilator and antibiotics

options.label: C
options.text: Classify as pneumonia and treat at PHC with oral amoxicillin

options.label: D
options.text: Reassure and advise mother to return in 2 weeks

questions.correct_answer: C. Classify as pneumonia and treat at PHC with oral amoxicillin
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Classify as pneumonia and treat at PHC with oral amoxicillin

questions.text: A 10-year-old child with recent measles has a TST showing 3 mm induration. Which of the following statements about false TST results are correct? Measles infection can cause false negative Mantoux test. BCG vaccination is a common cause of false positive results. HIV/AIDS can cause both false positive and false negative TST. Repeat testing with purified tuberculin improves specificity.

A 32-year-old public health resident is designing a community TB awareness campaign aligned with global health goals. She refers to the WHO End TB Strategy aiming for specific targets by 2035. Which of the following is not among the strategic targets outlined in the End TB vision?

options.label: A
options.text: 90% reduction in new TB cases globally

options.label: B
options.text: Elimination of catastrophic costs for TB-affected households

options.label: D
options.text: Complete eradication of drug-resistant TB cases by 2025

questions.correct_answer: D. Complete eradication of drug-resistant TB cases by 2025
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Complete eradication of drug-resistant TB cases by 2025

questions.text: A 15-year-old previously healthy adolescent presents for a routine school physical. The pediatrician discusses updates to the immunization schedule and notes that the patient is now eligible for a conjugate vaccine targeting a pathogen responsible for outbreaks in close-contact environments like dormitories. Which of the following individuals is most appropriately recommended to receive this vaccine?

options.label: C
options.text: A college-bound teenager entering a residential hall

options.label: D
options.text: A school teacher exposed to children daily

questions.correct_answer: C. A college-bound teenager entering a residential hall
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A college-bound teenager entering a residential hall

questions.text: A public health officer is reviewing district-level malaria surveillance data to assess the impact of vector control measures. Which of the following metrics is least likely to serve as a standard surveillance indicator in malaria-endemic regions?

A city reports rising cases of dog bites and a confirmed human rabies death. A task force is formed to implement a practical and affordable rabies control plan for the urban population, prioritizing both human safety and long-term disease elimination. Which of the following public health interventions is most logical and cost-effective in this setting?

options.label: A
options.text: Implement ring vaccination around each human rabies case

options.label: C
options.text: Mass vaccination of stray and pet dogs, with stray dog population control

options.label: D
options.text: Routine pre-exposure vaccination for all city residents

questions.correct_answer: C. Mass vaccination of stray and pet dogs, with stray dog population control
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Mass vaccination of stray and pet dogs, with stray dog population control

questions.text: A 28-year-old man presents with painful, enlarged lymph nodes in the groin and axilla. He is febrile and reports handling rodents in a rural area with recent rodent die-offs. Examination reveals tender fluctuant buboes. Blood culture is pending. Which of the following organisms most likely transmits this infection?

options.label: B
options.text: Rat flea of the genus Xenopsylla

options.label: D
options.text: Hard tick of the Ixodes genus

questions.correct_answer: B. Rat flea of the genus Xenopsylla
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Rat flea of the genus Xenopsylla

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) for HIV are true? PEP must be initiated within 72 hours of exposure for maximal efficacy. Two-drug regimens are equally effective as three-drug regimens. Tenofovir, lamivudine, and lopinavir/ritonavir is a recommended combination. PEP is continued for a total of 28 days once initiated.

A 27-year-old man presents to urgent care 4 hours after sustaining a minor, clean puncture wound from a sterile nail while assembling furniture at home. He recalls receiving his last tetanus booster approximately 10 years ago and has no history of immunodeficiency. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in his management?

options.label: A
options.text: No intervention needed due to low-risk wound

options.label: D
options.text: Start tetanus immunoglobulin and full toxoid series

questions.correct_answer: B. Administer tetanus toxoid booster only
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Administer tetanus toxoid booster only

questions.text: During a cholera outbreak in a densely populated urban settlement, a sanitation team is tasked with safe disposal of stools from infected individuals. The officer in charge selects a disinfectant with a Rideal-Walker coefficient (RWC) of 3. Which of the following best describes the appropriateness of this selection?

options.label: A
options.text: Suitable, as any phenolic solution is effective regardless of RWC

options.label: B
options.text: Acceptable if used in combination with lime or bleach

options.label: C
options.text: Inappropriate, as only disinfectants with RWC >10 should be used

options.label: D
options.text: Preferred method is boiling stool containers, not chemical disinfection

questions.correct_answer: C. Inappropriate, as only disinfectants with RWC >10 should be used
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Inappropriate, as only disinfectants with RWC >10 should be used

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman is participating in a community screening program. She weighs 92 kg and her height is 1.58 meters. What is the correct classification of her obesity grade?

In a follow-up phase of NCD surveillance, patients undergo blood sampling to assess fasting glucose, triglycerides, and HDL cholesterol. According to the WHO steps approach, which category and step does this represent?

Which of the following statements about the Haddon Matrix are true? Pre-injury interventions aim to eliminate exposure to risk factors. Vehicle airbags are considered a post-injury environmental factor. Enforcement of seatbelt laws is a pre-injury socioeconomic strategy. Flammable building materials are considered part of the injury phase.

A 10-month-old child is found abandoned and brought to a pediatric unit. The child is listless and severely underweight. Weight-for-height z-score is –2.5 SD, MUAC is 119 mm, and there is no visible wasting or edema. Based on WHO classification, does this child meet the criteria for severe acute malnutrition?

options.label: A
options.text: Yes, because weight-for-height z-score is less than –2 SD

options.label: B
options.text: Yes, because of weight-for-height z-score less than –3 SD

options.label: C
options.text: No, because none of the criteria for SAM are met

options.label: D
options.text: No, because MUAC is below 120 mm

questions.correct_answer: C. No, because none of the criteria for SAM are met
questions.explanation: Ans. C) No, because none of the criteria for SAM are met

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy in a tribal region of Maharashtra develops fever, rash, and eschar. His serum IgM is positive for Orientia tsutsugamushi. Which of the following arthropods most likely transmitted the infection?
Which of the following features is not associated with the DOTS-99 strategy?

options.label: A
options.text: Use of hidden phone numbers for dose confirmation

options.label: B
options.text: ICT-based surveillance of TB diagnosis and referrals

options.label: C
options.text: Verification that the dose was physically handled by the patient

options.label: D
options.text: Use of a toll-free call made after each dose

questions.correct_answer: B. ICT-based surveillance of TB diagnosis and referrals
questions.explanation: Ans. B) ICT-based surveillance of TB diagnosis and referrals

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy presents with cerebral malaria in Jharkhand. He is given IV artesunate initially. Once stable, he is ready for oral therapy. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

A public health consultant is tasked with designing infrastructure for Ayushman Bharat. Which of the following best describes the eligibility requirement for a private hospital to be empaneled under PMJAY?

options.label: A
options.text: Must have an attached blood bank

options.label: B
options.text: Should perform only primary care services

questions.correct_answer: D. Must have more than 10 beds
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Must have more than 10 beds

questions.text: A local Anganwadi center lacks a toilet facility, causing caregivers to use nearby fields for defecation. Which government body is responsible for construction of sanitation facilities in this scenario under SBM-G?

options.label: B
options.text: Ministry of Women and Child Development

questions.correct_answer: B. Ministry of Women and Child Development
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Ministry of Women and Child Development

questions.text: During National Deworming Day, a PHC erroneously administers one albendazole tablet each to all children under 5 years. Later, a 15-month-old develops intestinal obstruction due to worm load. What age-specific error likely occurred?

options.label: A
options.text: A ½ tablet should have been given to children aged 12–24 months

options.label: B
options.text: Child was not due for deworming till 24 months

options.label: D
options.text: Only pink IFA tablets should be used in this age

questions.correct_answer: A. A ½ tablet should have been given to children aged 12–24 months
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A ½ tablet should have been given to children aged 12–24 months

questions.text: A hospital receives a limited supply of equine RIG (eRIG). Which of the following patients should receive highest priority for allocation of RIG?

options.label: A
options.text: A woman with superficial scratch on forearm from a vaccinated pet

options.label: B
options.text: A child bitten on the lower leg by a healthy dog

options.label: C
options.text: A man with multiple deep bites on the face by a suspected rabid dog

options.label: D
options.text: A healthcare worker with a needle-stick injury from a syringe used on a rabid dog

questions.correct_answer: C. A man with multiple deep bites on the face by a suspected rabid dog
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A man with multiple deep bites on the face by a suspected rabid dog

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the Health Education Approach are accurate? It focuses on changing knowledge, attitudes, and behaviors through voluntary learning. It yields immediate results in acute public health crises. It often involves IEC campaigns, community meetings, and participatory learning. It complements regulatory or service approaches for sustained change.

A researcher compares the hemoglobin levels of patients before and after iron therapy within the same cohort. Which of the following statements are true? The appropriate test is the paired Student’s t-test. The sample involves unpaired data. This test compares the means within a single group measured twice. A chi-square test would be more accurate in this situation.
Which of the following interventions is most likely to flatten the left side of the bathtub curve?

options.label: C
options.text: Antenatal care, institutional deliveries, and neonatal resuscitation

options.label: D
options.text: Subsidized cardiac surgeries in middle age

questions.correct_answer: C. Antenatal care, institutional deliveries, and neonatal resuscitation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Antenatal care, institutional deliveries, and neonatal resuscitation

questions.text: A medical researcher is analyzing hemoglobin levels in a population sample. To construct a confidence interval, which of the following elements are essential?

A medical student is analyzing a dataset of 100 children to assess the relationship between their height (in cm) and weight (in kg). Which of the following graphical tools is most appropriate to visually depict the correlation between these two continuous variables?

A public health intern is asked to summarize how spread out the systolic blood pressure readings are in a community health survey. She reviews several statistical tools to measure dispersion or variability in data. Which of the following is not considered a measure of dispersion?

A clinical researcher is comparing the proportion of smokers who developed lung cancer in two different hospital populations. Which of the following statistical tests is most appropriate to compare two proportions?
Which of the following scenarios best illustrates the inappropriateness of simple random sampling?

options.label: A
options.text: A homogenous group of patients receiving care at a small rural clinic

options.label: B
options.text: Sampling from a complete list of postal codes using a lottery method

options.label: C
options.text: Sampling individuals from a large, socioeconomically diverse urban population without stratification

options.label: D
options.text: Allocating subjects into treatment arms of a randomized controlled trial using a computer algorithm

questions.correct_answer: C. Sampling individuals from a large, socioeconomically diverse urban population without stratification
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Sampling individuals from a large, socioeconomically diverse urban population without stratification

questions.text: A bioterrorism response plan includes surveillance for melioidosis, psittacosis, and brucellosis. What is common to all of these agents in terms of CDC categorization?

options.label: A
options.text: All are in Category A due to their pandemic potential

options.label: B
options.text: All are excluded from bioterror consideration due to low transmissibility

options.label: C
options.text: All fall under Category B and require enhanced diagnostic surveillance

options.label: D
options.text: All are newly classified under Category C due to zoonotic origin

questions.correct_answer: C. All fall under Category B and require enhanced diagnostic surveillance
questions.explanation: Ans. C) All fall under Category B and require enhanced diagnostic surveillance

questions.text: A policy analyst studying international collaborations on health promotion in post-independence Asia reviews a 1950 initiative involving 20 nations. This program emphasized raising living standards via industrial, agricultural, and health sector support—often through fellowships. Which global initiative is being referenced?

A hospital administrator wants to evaluate which of two programs to fund: one that reduces hospitalizations and another that prevents strokes. Benefits are measured in natural units like “number of strokes prevented.” Which technique should be applied?

A new maternal health clinic reports a high proportion of local pregnant women attending their first antenatal visit. However, several women cite long wait times and lack of female staff as concerns. Which component of health service evaluation is primarily being compromised?
Which of the following best differentiates a goal from an objective in public health programs?

options.label: A
options.text: Goals are always more time-bound than objectives

options.label: B
options.text: Objectives represent a broader vision, while goals focus on individual tasks

options.label: C
options.text: Goals are aspirational and not necessarily achievable; objectives are precise and problem-oriented

options.label: D
options.text: Objectives are constrained by resources; goals are not measurable

questions.correct_answer: C. Goals are aspirational and not necessarily achievable; objectives are precise and problem-oriented
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Goals are aspirational and not necessarily achievable; objectives are precise and problem-oriented

questions.text: A sudden increase in diarrhea cases prompts the male health worker to distribute ORS sachets and identify water sources needing chlorination. His dual role here reflects which key principle of primary health care?
questions.correct_answer: C. Intersectoral coordination and preventive care
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Intersectoral coordination and preventive care

questions.text: A district hospital administrator is reviewing staffing patterns. In accordance with Indian norms, how many health assistants (male and female) should ideally be deployed to cover a population of 60,000 in a tribal district?

Which of the following characteristics distinguish health education from health propaganda? Acquired through passive methods Enhances individuality and personality Encourages reflective over reflexive behavior Emotion-centered process

A 32-year-old male working in a manufacturing plant reports increased fatigue due to extended shifts. His supervisor insists that the factory is within legally permissible working limits. According to the Indian Factories Act, what is the maximum number of working hours permitted per person per week?

Which scenarios are examples of violations of Hardy-Weinberg assumptions? A population where individuals migrate seasonally and interbreed with new groups A randomly mating population with no new mutations or gene flow A group where mating is restricted within the same religion or caste Introduction of a new allele through horizontal gene transfer A natural disaster causing random loss of genetic variation

A 38-year-old mechanic presents with chronic fatigue, abdominal pain, and constipation. On exam, he has facial pallor and a bluish-black line on the gums. His hemoglobin is low, and peripheral smear reveals basophilic stippling. What is the most sensitive early laboratory test to confirm lead exposure?
A 48-year-old cotton textile worker presents with symptoms of chest tightness that worsen at the beginning of the workweek and improve by Friday. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A government agency implements policies requiring earthquake-resistant infrastructure and early warning systems in high-risk zones. These actions are best categorized under which phase of disaster management?

A municipal health authority switches to a pesticide with lower mammalian toxicity than DDT for periodic indoor spraying against mosquitoes. Which of the following agents is most consistent with this policy?

A 6-year-old boy presents with intense itching between the fingers, especially at night. He lives in a densely populated urban area with limited access to running water. On examination, burrows and excoriations are noted on the hands and wrists. Which of the following categories best describes the mode of transmission of this disease in public health classification?
The Central Pollution Control Board is alerted to multiple asthma flare-ups in a school zone. Air quality monitoring shows a dark red-coded AQI. What is the most appropriate health advisory?

options.label: A
options.text: No intervention needed unless AQI persists for a week

options.label: B
options.text: Vulnerable groups only to stay indoors

options.label: C
options.text: Issue public health alert and restrict outdoor activities

options.label: D
options.text: Only schools should be closed, rest of city can function normally

questions.correct_answer: C. Issue public health alert and restrict outdoor activities
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Issue public health alert and restrict outdoor activities

questions.text: Which of the following diseases is transmitted by Musca domestica? Yaws Anthrax Trachoma Malaria Conjunctivitis Typhoid Cholera Polio Covid-19
